page.title: 05A Dying Industry??
page.content:
This unique life style and the old traditional methods of fishing has been passed down from father to son.
Due to falling catches, the hard life and the effort needed to make a living,interest is steadily declining. Even when the catch is back home there is a lot of work to do.Fish have to be cleaned and filleted, cockles washed and boiled, shrimps cooked and picked. Picking, to remove the shell, actually provides a number of housewives with a way to supplement their incomes.
It does seem a pity that this unique industry is in danger of dying out but maybe, Teena may carry on her families traditional form of employment.
